chunk_00001.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Central Perk coffee shop — evening, warm interior lighting with visible bar and seating area.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: dark-colored sleeveless top - dark pants - blonde, braided hair - expression shifts from concerned to smiling
Monica Geller: dark-colored striped shirt - dark pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - expression: serious, then smiling
Chandler Bing: dark-colored shirt with light vest - light-colored pants - brown, medium-length hair - expression: animated, gesturing
Ross Geller: light-colored striped shirt - dark pants - dark, short hair - expression: serious, hands clasped
Joey Tribbiani: dark-colored shirt - dark pants - brown, medium-length hair - expression: relaxed, listening
Phoebe Buffay: denim vest over dark top - dark pants - blonde, shoulder-length hair - expression: concerned, then smiling

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
The group is seated in the coffee shop, engaged in a conversation. Ross Geller sits with hands clasped, appearing serious as he speaks. Chandler Bing gestures animatedly while talking, leaning back in his chair. Monica Geller sits with arms crossed, listening intently and smiling at times. Rachel Green sits on the floor, looking up at the group, her expression shifting from concern to a smile. Phoebe Buffay sits on a bar stool, listening to the conversation. Joey Tribbiani sits on the couch, listening to the group.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on table)
- Orange couch (center of frame)
- Wooden table (with items on it)
- Bar stools (with people sitting on them)
- Brick wall decor (background)
- Menu board (behind counter)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller discusses the importance of kissing in relationships with the group. The conversation has a casual, joking tone, with Ross appearing serious and Chandler animatedly responding. Monica Geller listens with a smile, while Rachel Green and Phoebe Buffay react with concern and amusement.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
None observed.
chunk_00001.subtitles: What you guys don't understand is... ...for us, kissing is as important as any part of it. Yeah, right. You serious? Oh, yeah. Everything you need to know is in that first kiss. - Absolutely. - Yeah, I think, for us... ...kissing is pretty much like an opening act. I mean, it's like the stand-up comedian you have to sit through... ...before Pink Floyd comes out. Yeah, and it's not that we don't like the comedian. It's just that that's not... ...why we bought the ticket. See, the problem is, though... ...after the concert's over, no matter how great the show was... ...you girls are always looking for the comedian again. I mean, we're in the car, we're fighting traffic... ...basically just trying to stay awake. Yeah, well, word of advice: Bring back the comedian. Otherwise, you're gonna find yourself...
chunk_00001.episode: 1x02 - The One with the Sonogram at the End

chunk_00003.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Museum of Prehistoric History — indoor, artificial lighting
The scene is set inside a museum exhibit featuring life-sized prehistoric human figures in a jungle-like environment with large artificial plants and rocks.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: blue denim shirt - brown trousers - dark, short hair - animated, gesturing while speaking
Rachel Green: blue patterned dress - unclear hair color/length - smiling, listening
Unidentified person: red vest over white shirt - dark pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - speaking and gesturing

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross Geller is enthusiastically gesturing and talking to Rachel Green, who is standing near a glass barrier observing the exhibit. Ross appears animated and expressive, using his hands to emphasize his points. The unidentified person, wearing a red vest, is also speaking and gesturing towards the prehistoric figures, seemingly explaining the exhibit to Ross and Rachel. Ross then turns and walks away from the exhibit, while Rachel remains standing and watching.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Prehistoric human figures: life-sized mannequins in fur clothing (background)
- Large artificial plants: green banana leaves (background)
- Glass barrier: separating the exhibit from the viewing area
- Sign: "COMING SOON PREHISTORIC LIFE EXHIBITION" (on a stand near the exhibit)
- Rocks and dirt: part of the exhibit's ground setting

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller discusses prehistoric life with Rachel Green, referencing the exhibit's content and making humorous comments about the figures' "issues."
chunk_00003.subtitles: ROSS: No, it's good. It is good. It's just that, doesn't she seem a little angry? Well, she has issues. Does she? He's out banging other women over the head with a club... ...while she sits at home trying to get the mastodon smell out of the carpet. Marsha, see, these are cave people. Okay, they have issues like: "Gee, that glacier's getting kind of close." See? Speaking of issues, isn't that your ex-wife? - No, no. - Yes, it is. Carol, hi. ROSS: Okay. Yes. Yes, it is. How about I'll catch up with you in the Ice Age? - Hi. - Hi.

chunk_00005.subtitles: ...where's there's some kind of misunderstanding. Then I've already seen this one. Are you through with that? Thanks. Yeah, sorry, the swallowing slowed me down. Whose little ball of paper is this? Oh, that would be mine. See, I wrote a note to myself, then I didn't need it. So I balled it up and now I wish I was dead. [SCOFFS] She already fluffed that pillow. Monica, you know, you already fluffed... But it's fine. Look, I'm sorry. I don't want to give them any more ammunition than they have. chunk_00008.subtitles: Oh, that is not a happy "hi." Carol's pregnant. Oh, I found it. Well, what...? What? Yeah. Do that for another two hours... ...you might be where I am right about now. Kind of puts that whole pillow thing in perspective, huh, Mon? Well, now, how do you fit into this whole thing? Well, Carol says she and Susan want me to be involved. But if I'm not comfortable with it, I don't have to be involved. Basically, it's totally up to me. She is so great. I miss her. What does she mean by "involved"? I mean, presumably, the biggest part of your job is done. Anyway, they want me to go down to this... ...sonogram thing with them tomorrow. So, what are you gonna do? I have no idea. No matter what I do, though, I'm still gonna be a father.

Why is this girl going to call me? Oh, she just graduated, and she wants to be something in cooking or food... ...or I don't know. Anyway, I told her you had a restaurant, so... No, Mom. chunk_00010.subtitles: Well, they don't have to know that. Ross, could you come and help me with the spaghetti. Yes. Oh, we're having spaghetti. That's... ...easy. I know this is going to sound unbelievably selfish on my part... ...but were you planning on bringing up the whole baby/lesbian thing? Because I think it might take some of the heat off me. What that Rachel did to her life. We ran into her parents at the club. They were not playing very well. I'm not gonna tell you what they spent on that wedding... ...but $40,000 is a lot of money. Well, at least she had the chance to leave a man at the altar. - What's that supposed to mean? - Nothing. - It's an expression. - No, it's not. Don't listen to your mother. Ross Geller discusses his past
chunk_00011.subtitles: Even when you were a kid, and you were chubby... ...and you had no friends, you were just fine. You'd read alone in your room. And your puzzles... Look, there are people, like Ross, who need to shoot for the stars. With his museum and his papers getting published. Other people are satisfied with staying where they are. I'm telling you, these are the people who never get cancer. And I read about these women trying to have it all, and I thank God... ...our little Harmonica doesn't seem to have that problem. So, Ross, what's going on with you? Any stories? No news, no little anecdotes to share with the folks? Okay, okay. Ahem. Look, I, uh... I realize you guys have been wondering... ...what exactly happened between Carol and me. And so, well, here's the deal.

chunk_00014.subtitles: - Oh, a little. - Mm-hm. - A lot. - Mm-hm. So got any advice? You know, as someone who's recently been dumped. Well, you may want to steer clear of the word "dumped." Chances are he's going to be this broken shell of a man. You know? So you should try not to look too terrific. I know it'll be hard. Or, you know, hey, I'll go down there, and I'll give Barry back his ring. And you can go with Carol and Susan to the OB-GYN. You've got Carol tomorrow. When did it get so complicated? Got me. - Remember when we were in high school? - Yeah. I mean, didn't you think you' were gonna meet someone... ...fall in love, and that'd be it? [SCOFFS]
chunk_00014.episode: 1x02 - The One with the Sonogram at the End

chunk_00021.subtitles: And we all know what a challenge that is. - Uh-huh. See? - All right, you two, stop it. No, no. She gets a credit. Hey, I'm in there too. Honestly. Any nausea? - A little. - Just a little. Well, I was just wondering about the mother-to-be, but, uh, thanks for sharing. Uh, lie back. You know what? I'm gonna go. Chandler Bing and Joey Tribbiani sit on the couch, looking at the screen with concerned expressions. Phoebe Buffay sits on the couch, looking at the screen with a concerned expression. An unidentified person stands near the kitchen area, looking at the screen with a concerned expression.

chunk_00022.subtitles: Oh, my God. Look at that. I know. Well, isn't that amazing? What are we supposed to be seeing here? I don't know, but I think it's about to attack the Enterprise. You know, if you tilt your head to the left and relax your eyes... ...it kind of looks like an old potato. Then don't do that, all right? Monica? What do you think? Mm-hm. Are you welling up? - No. - You are. - You are. You're welling up. - No, I'm not.

chunk_00023.subtitles: - You are. You're welling up. - No, I'm not. - You're gonna be an aunt. - Oh, shut up. Hi, Mindy. Hi, it's Rachel. Yeah, I'm fine. I saw Barry today. Oh, yeah, yeah, he told me. No, it's okay. Really, it's okay. I hope you two are very happy. I really do. And, Min, you know, if everything works out... ...and you guys end up getting married and having kids and everything... ...I just hope they have his old hairline and your old nose. Okay, I know it was a cheap shot, but I feel so much better now.
